name: turtlesystems-azure-storage
description: Upload files to the named storage container and optionally create SAS token
author: Turtlesystems Consulting Ltd
instanceNameFormat: Upload files to Azure Storage container

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager to use

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Action for this task to perform

options.create: Create Resource Group and Storage Account
options.delete: Remove Resource Group and Storage Account

inputs.name: resourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the resource group in which the storage account exists or should be created

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location for deploying the resource group and storage account. If the they already exists in the subscription, then this value will be ignored.

inputs.name: storageAccountName
inputs.label: Storage Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the storage account to create. This must be globally unique

inputs.name: containerName
inputs.label: Container
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the container to create within the specified storage account

inputs.name: uploadDirectory
inputs.label: Upload Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory containing the files to upload

inputs.name: sasTokenStartTime
inputs.label: SAS Token Start Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: State when the start time of the token should be. Accepts relative values from now, such as 2m or 4 hours for example, to create a date in the past. This is useful to help avoid clock drift on machines.

inputs.name: sasTokenExpiryTime
inputs.label: SAS Token Expiry Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the expiry time of the SAS token. Accepts relative values from now, such as 1 hr or 4 hours, which will allow the token to be used for the next 4 hours.

inputs.name: vstsSasTokenVariableName
inputs.label: VSTS SAS Token Variable Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: If specified the SAS token will be set in the specified VSTS variable for subsequent tasks to make use of.
